alert.note: Alert for Humboldt County; Northern Lander County and Northern Eureka County; Southwest Elko County (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 12 at 1:06AM PST until December 12 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Elko
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations, valleys 1 to 5 inches, mountains 5 to 10 inches. Westerly wind gusts of 10 to 20 mph in valleys, and 20 to 35 mph in mountains and over higher summits. * WHERE...Humboldt County, Northern Lander County and Northern Eureka County and Southwest Elko County. * WHEN...Until 10 PM PST this evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult due to slippery roads, reduced visibilities, and possibly drifting of snow. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The combination of recent snow or slush along with the new snowfall, and near to below freezing temperatures, will keep many roadways slippery through this evening. Blowing and drifting of snow is possible in valleys, and likely across mountains and higher summits where winds will be strongest.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Humboldt County; Northern Lander County and Northern Eureka County; Southwest Elko County
